intro: Euphoebe cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf euphobia, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Euphoebe cuneata is often found in rich, loamy soils and is an important component of moist forest ecosystems.
